bow: this mom has no friends in college was social butterfly had more friends than needed being one of the first of my friends to get married amp have baby is lonely path at times hubby has hobbies that get him out of the house and mingling with people but my main hobby is my beautiful month old daughter we had close friends with baby but they ve gotten busy and we ve drifted over the past year and we are now just liking each other baby pics on facebook my efforts to reach put to them again and again are fruitless go to some play groups with local moms but really just have clicked with any of them ladies seeking some advice or encouragement guess feeling rather lonely surely some of you have been through this have started joking groups on mee up com have net few people highly suggest it know exactly how you feel have zero friends spend most of my time reading online and taking care of my two year old so isolated from the outside world really sucks deleted are you me terribly sorry we are so alike hugs for you my dear my advice would be to go places you enjoy and talk to lot of people making mom friends is like dating it is numbers game talk to other parents while pushing my son on the swings at the zoo in cafes at the grocery store etc if you meet someone interesting exchange numbers and follow up aside from my old friends with kids have friends made after my 14 month old son one from prenatal yoga that hang out with regularly as social stay at home mom with social son ca tell you how much happier time with friends makes both of us am big believer in living the life you want to live now in my experience there is never time when life is easy in similar boat moved to korea about years ago where met amp married my husband legally anyway wedding in nov and we had our daughter 14 months now had ton of friends from my previous work amp even some from home korea is place most people stay long term and due to this everyone has gone home love lot of my husbands friends but they re all boys stuck in college mode drinking partying etc add to this my poor korean and it means do really fit in anywhere did try the local english mom amp baby group they were very nice but had little in common with them they were almost all house wives of ceos amp about years my senior my husband commentates plays video games professionally keep myself sane by keeping up with friends family on skype facebook and kakao talk also have thrown myself feet first into pinterest amp have been crafting cooking baking up storm we have the odd house party too like to cook big meal and have all my boys over you re most certainly not alone keep going out or find project to keep you busy when your baby is good luck right back at ya it feels horrible to not have single friend where live and be stuck at home 24 with year old oh man feel the same way although work outside of the home and the adult interaction is nice am 100 time energy committed to family and work no room for friends and it sucks think from friends with older kids that social life kicks back in in couple of years even if that just our kids friends parents but ll take it deleted deleted in the same boat and the worst part of it all there is no one to meet other moms around here my kids are getting old enough that could do more outside the house but ca find anyone to hang out with moms around here drink or party for fun and that not me reader writer and overall pretty nerdy if you are looking to make more babies to get more welfare or use substance to escape your responsibilities there just is anyone to befriend on pinterest wayyyyy too much though it could be argued my family is much better for it currently trying to convince my husband that should get sewing machine there are so may cute sewing projects on there since we are all rowing our boats solo it might be time to organize local meet ups in the same boat but ve always had hard time making friends what were you doing differently back when you were social butterfly how did you strike up conversations and more importantly how did you convert casual conversation acquaintances into friends do those things not work anymore why we need to get the word out for the mommit meetup oy not mother yet sorry for lurking in your subreddit ladies but this worries me about the future already ve already had all of my female friendships fall apart within the past few years since do have time to go drinking every night after work leaving us with nothing in common teacher during weekdays and thoroughly enjoy spending my weekend time uninterrupted with the boyfriend after work come home to do chores then romp around the internet or play video games to relax which might need to take break from since have you tagged as mrs so there not much room for finding new meetup groups or things similar the boy has wonderful friends who consider some of to be my own good friends and love seeing them but if it already lonely in the lady world for me how worse is it going to feel when do have kids do just start looking into pinterest now no kidding put post on there months ago and no bites yet was the first to have baby too and apparently really picky about who am friends with because it took me long time to find other moms that liked was totally friendless the first year of motherhood and could seem to find anyone liked so joined multiple moms groups on meetup it was like speed dating and if thought may like someone do another meet up with them in the end ended up with my own tailor made group of mom friends we all have kids in elementary school now so we mostly get together for dinner or bunco or book club but we ll be friends for many years and ll never be lonely again anyway be proactive being mom is way more fun when you can bitch about it brag about your kids over coffee or wine with other parents had some awesome dad friends too you have to work for it but it totally worth it same here join moms club was you two years ago had baby stayed home and had recently moved to new city after months of solitude had had enough found local moms club at first it was weird really did have anything in common with the other moms but you all have kids and that is start now years later have some great friends go to the moms club international website they have chapters everywhere should also add that my daughter loves it we do playdates go all kinds of fun places and she loves being around other kids deleted was never good at the dating game so am so socially awkward when it comes to exchanging numbers with other moms tell me how to do it teach me your ways agreed edit cincinnati ohio here anyone else in the reno nv area most likely the nearest mom is in california kind of in the same boat in that do drive though that will be changing soon finally getting my driver license well into my mid 30s gt gt live in an isolated part of town so do get many visitors and it hard to pack up the baby for long bus rides ve tried going to story times and such but pretty nerdy and most of these moms are young and girly few of them are friendly but mostly me and my little guy are snubbed on the bright side was the first out of three friends to have baby one of my friends even had twins so kind of the wise mom of the group get texts and facebook messages all the time asking for advice and pass along baby stuff do need anymore we try to get together once week for coffee oh and we all had boys birthday parties are going to be interesting deleted same here quit working little over years ago to be sahm to my then two now three and soon to be four kids had many friends went out often when my older girls were with their dad and had had number three yet when moved in with my so stopped going to bars but he owned bar so still got to socialize with adults once had the baby that stopped and we have since closed the bar these days am pregnant with number four and rarely leave the house am so lucky though my so truly is my best friend and would much rather spend my time with him than most anyone else he feels the same way and rarely goes out without me we relish our free time together and do our best to spend it doing things we both enjoy there are times when miss female companionship and going out without kids but just would know who to even call about that anymore this is terrible advice op ca just make herself stop feeling bad if she lonely for adult company waiting five years for kid to go to school and then trying to make adult friends wo be any easier for her she should do everything she can now to get out of the house and talk to people play groups story time at the library parks museums the grocery store the coffee shop the pool all of these offer the potential to meet new people and make new friends simply holing up in her house feeling telling herself to get over it will only make things worse source woman who became much better mom once she made some friends and got out of the house regularly have no advice but in the same boat no real friends to speak of sometimes go couple of weeks at time without leaving the house and when do go out feel awkward and spaced out guess from the lack of human interaction ve always been outgoing and have never had problems making friends my biggest problem with finding other mom friends is our differences in parenting styles befriended this one girl down the street we would hang out and her baby would be screaming at the top of her lungs and she would be on her iphone completely oblivious good luck hope your quest for friend turns out better than mine the only difference between the two of us is that my daughter is sewing machines are relatively cheap craigslist should yield you gold for reconnecting try dinner club once per month invite bunch of friends to my house or park if it nice and have potluck with theme bring something round believe it or not was the only one to bring pie or red or from certain country region or your family favorite recipe in the same boat with my redheaded ferocious days away from year old daughter it happens lot unfortunately seattle area anyone in the same boat my husband is in the military so hours away from my family go to the spouses socials and the play dates every week but the women here mostly just complain complain about their husbands their kids this town the military so much negativity and shy last time went to the social took cup cakes because it was my son birthday and it was just for fun his party was till that weekend with my family over heard the ladies talking about how sad it was that was using the social as party for my son guess because the lady in charge tried to get all the kids to sing happy birthday to my son it was the first time over heard them talking about it so ve given up have few families near me who enjoy hanging out with form time to time and we take turns baby sitting for each other but would really call them friends good luck too am looking for group very similar to you also ve always found it easy to make at least casual friends and had too many in college got preggo right as was finishing grad school and then we moved to the twin cities anyone else here where we know almost no one both our families are thousands of miles away am 24 so of my far off friends that keep in touch with and or the couple in the cities the only mom and most people my age are only just thinking about getting engaged an unexpected downside of getting married at 18 most of the moms that ve met are significantly older and have older children ve made some close ish acquaintances and they were very generous in passing on old baby items but no true friends most of my days like you are just playing with our month old it been year now since moved back from grad school and only in the last month or so have started feeling like have friends but still none that are moms particularly of children around our daughter age it makes me feel little better that not the only one really was starting to feel like there something wrong with me for not seemingly being able to meet people anymore of the friends have made ve just had to learn to be lot more aggressive about pursuing phone numbers and getting together with people as soon as think *might* want to be friends do have semester of class or chamber music to get to know them through osmosis which is realized how most of my friends happened throughout my school years since while fairly outgoing also bit shy now that my munchkin is getting old enough to see beyond until was 30 but reading this remembered that once was out of college and just working it became harder and harder to make friends gradually all my college friends moved out of town and was pretty lonely ve heard from many other friends that this happened for them after college too so that may be one issue that is happening for you then after having my kid found that it gradually became easier and easier again conversations usually started with how old is yours and then questions about whether they are crawling walking sleeping talking etc have found that making friends after college is much harder work it takes an intentional effort found that going to the same activitiy story time park gym class etc regularly and then trying to set up playdate with the moms who seemed interesting was helpful most new moms are lonely too and it takes someone to initiate it it is lot like dating some playdates lead to second dates some do it takes time to establish those relationships though my son is now and all of my closest friends are friends that met since he was born who have kids his age it can happen for you say try to be the initiator invite someone over for playdate and very soon you ll be having deeper conversations good luck deleted the dating numbers game thing means you have to talk to lot of people before you meet someone you click with to meet more friends you have to talk to more people the great thing about meeting mom friends is that just by having children you already have lot in common with someone people *love* talking about their children so you have the perfect ice breaker standing in front of you their kids usually start by asking how old the kid is or saying something about how cute the kid is ve even walked up to kids with my son so that the kids could look at each other and interact kind of what you might do with two dogs at dog park when meet someone connect with say something like it been great talking lets stay in touch get together sometime soon and ask for number ve found it easiest to send text to the person phone right there send quick message saying something like great to meet you and include my full name my son name and his age just realized never talk on the phone unless it my mom with friends text to stay in touch and schedule get togethers usually follow up within few days to setup get together though with one of my best mama friends something like month went by my son is still really young but my experience so far is that most social interactions have these days can be construed as socially awkward because have split attention on the one hand having conversation but on the other am trying to keep the baby from mayhem so do worry about awkwardness the more you practice and model social behavior the more it will help your kids it will be good for them to see how you navigate approaching others and the time you invest in friendship one side note lot of people complain about how moms spend all their time one upping each other about their children development successes etc this has not been my experience at all we do talk about our children lot but that is because our children are such large part of our lives do assume that other moms are judging you even if you are different if you do meet some judgy pants you can move on my friends and all vary lot in how we raise our kids work or stay home handle finances feed our babies co sleep vs sleep train etc will say though that my friends treat their children and other people respectfully and with love good luck you can do it definitely get her to help you you will be so glad you did have made my own clothes and always get compliments on them it definitely worth it it not always cheaper but you get clothes that fit better are more durable with matching beret before got pregnant ca find it now but if you re into capes they re fairly easy once you get the hang of it once you get out there again it gets easier you will have lot in common with other moms just by virtue of being parents the same concerns constraints and activities my son just wanted to nurse for the first six months and would cry lot so it was hard for me to get out
